intro: Ribes mescalerium, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada currant, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, edible berries that ripen in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions.
